inn1.comm: starts off on a length and Marsh plays it towards point
marginally fuller and he squirts it to the off side again
no pace to speak of yet, pitches on the stumps and he defends
there's a good ball, pitching full to commit Marsh forward, and then straightening to beat the bat as he pushes down the wrong line, well bowled, Steyn

now an appeal, as Steyn pitches in line and straightens the ball, Marsh doesn't move forward much and neither does he play much of a shot, the ball strikes him just outside off stump and was doing too much as well, then it clips his pad ans runs away through the slips, which doesn't impress Steyn much
on the stumps and he keeps the last ball of the over out
and he's off the mark first ball, easing forward and dabbing into cover
pitches full and wide and Marsh does his best Test leave impersonation
now he makes Marsh play, and he drives the ball straight to mid-off
too straight, Marsh tucks it to midwicket and Warner sprints down, a bit of hesitation on Marsh's part but Warner was away and he knew he wanted one
135.7ks, back of a length and he shoulders arms to it
pitches on a length and he gets back to steer it to point
pitches just around off stump and played straight to backward point
walks into a good-looking drive but cannot beat the man at mid-off
a pinched single, just a tap towards Duminy at cover and they sprint
146ks, pitching and angling across and he leaves it be
pitches short of a length, steered to the off, but can't beat Duminy
first four of the day and some aggression from Warner, who latches onto a short ball from well outside off stump and pulls into the ground wide of mid-off, cracking shot that too
pitches full and gets Marsh coming forward, defending to backward point
better length, then straightening, to beat Marsh's attempt to dab it fine
137ks, more carry and bounce this time to beat a feeble shot
gets a bit of room and thrashes that up and wide of point
better shot, Marsh walks into it and pushes it past Botha at mid-off
pitches back of a length and Marsh steers it to backward point

lovely delivery, pitching short of a length in line with the stumps and nipping off the upright seam, cramping and squaring up Warner, with no foot movement, and the half-hearted shot towards the on side draws a faint edge through to Boucher, and thus Warner fails on his ODI debut
pitches down leg and slides by as Ponting shuffles across and half-flirts, half-leaves, there's a noise as the ball brushes his hips, Boucher half-appeals
brings him forward and he defends solidly to the off side
144.4ks, pitches a wee bit wider and Ponting shoulders arms
pitches full and slides back in with the angle, but Ponting comes forward and raises the bat again to allow the ball swing back in late to Boucher
and he's away with a trademark boundary, Steyn pitches on his preferred area and Ponting clips it through midwicket to draw some hearty cheer from the crowd
ooh, in the air but safe, March squirts a drive up and wide of backward point and the fast outfield takes the ball out to the ropes, where the sweeper mops up
137ks, some awkward bounce gets the batsman surprised
and again the ball sits up off a length and Marsh, lunging forward, has to take his bottom hand off the bat handle, the ball nips up and rolls to the on side
that's a fine shot, he gets room and cuts through a diving point fielder
shorter delivery bounces more than anticipated but Marsh does well, riding the carry and angling it down past the slips to third man
pitches full but too wide of the crease and Ponting strides in to leave it be
lands it on a good length and Marsh pushes it to the man at cover
145.2ks, angling across and he raises the bat to allow it pass
pitches just outside leg stump and swings in to hit the pad as Marsh falls towards the off side in defence, Steyn appeals rather unconvincingly and Ian Gould walks away
leans forward and drives on the rise to the fielder placed at mid-off
gets across and cuts it down into the ground in front of a tumbling point, the ball wasn't that wide but Marsh adjusted to pick the gap and hit the ball hard too
pitches on a better length and Marsh pushes it to the off side
pitches on a length and Ponting gets that front leg a long way forward to play it on the half-volley and then streakily square-drives past gully and down to third man
much straighter, Marsh gets well forward and pats it back to Ntini
gets to the pitch and drives on the rise towards cover, there are shouts of catch but the ball drops just short of Duminy as he falls to his left, and runs away as well
shuffles across and turns this one away, but cannot beat midwicket
pitches wide and straightens and Marsh gets forward and shoulders arms
pitches wide and comes back in but he's confident leaving it be
pitches full and a bit too wide and he leaves it be too
there's the length, straightening as well, and Ponting thrusts forward
commits to the front foot and steers the ball to point, who fields well
ah, now Ponting chases length, driving hard and on the rise, and ends up placing the ball in the air and backward of point out to the fielder running across from third man
145.5ks, pitches short of a length and Marsh decides he'd like to pull that one, but the ball stays a touch low and angles across to hit him in the jewels, ouch
pitches on a length and swings in and Marsh gets back to defend well
comes forward to defend and then hurries to dab the angle bat on it, a bit of a late chopped shot towards third man, and backward point does the fielding to keep Marsh to the single
throws the bat at that fullish delivery, driving on the rise very hard to extra cover, where Botha does well to get a hand on it and take some pace of the ball
goes to cut when he sees width except the ball stays low and beats him
comes forward, then back, and drives very well but Duminy dives and intercepts that eye-catching stroke in the covers with an equally impressive stop there
thats short and rising and Ponting gets up to chop the ball to point
139.7ks, angles back in and Ponting throws himself at it, it gets big on him and takes the high part of the bat as he chops it to the off side
pace and bounce, sitting up off a sweet spot and buzzing past Ponting
pitches on about leg stump, straightens, and Marsh taps it back to Steyn
good stuff this, pitching 148ks and on a lovely length, Marsh defends

holds back the length and Marsh, inching forward, adjusts to dab the ball to the off side, there is more jittery calling between him and Ponting, Marsh wanted one and has to send his captain back when he sees two fielders converging
pitches on off stump and swings back in to Marsh, who has to defend
slower ball, 116ks, pitches full and Marsh gets forward to defend
brings Marsh forward, and he miscues the on-the-walk drive to cover
looks to swat that over the midwicket vicinity, off the front foot, but he swings and misses! Ponting plants the front foot well forward and goes for an ugly hoik but cannot connect
gets to the pitch of a length ball and drives on the rise to a diving cover
pitches wide and Ponting gives it a mighty swing, and misses as it stays low
no stopping that, that's one of those shots which you just let go and say "well, played, mate", just eased into the gap at point by Ponting, on the rise again
pitches back of a length on the seam and Ponting has to defends this time

McKenzie drops him at short cover! Again Ponting decides to attack Ntini and lunges forward to cover the pitch before he hammers the drive on the up, it goes straight into McKenzie's grasp but he lets the ball out on the rebound, now now, what will that cost?
offers Marsh some room and he glides it superbly down to third man
pitches fuller and Marsh pushes the ball to the off side
walks into a good-looking shot toward mid-off and sets off, the fielder runs across and collects and fires in a direct hit but Marsh is safely home to the other end
good shot from Ponting, hitting into the gap at midwicket and mid-on
130.8ks, on a good length and Ponting lunges forward to defend
pitches straighter and in the slot and Ponting hits it down the ground
drops it a bit short and Marsh swivels on a pull to deep square leg
dragged in even shorter and Ponting hooks it in the air over the gap at short fine leg, he was a bit surprised but hit the ball well, one fielder stops and the other throws it back
comes forward and dabs this one towards the fielder for one
short of a length, Marsh gets in line and pushes it back to Albie
134.4ks, fuller outside off stump and Marsh drives it to cover
tidy stuff, hitting that back-of-a-length spot and Marsh plays it to cover
pitches full and brings Ponting onto the front foot, defending it back
clears the front leg and slog-sweeps that over midwicket, really not timed at all but Ponting manages to clear the in field and the ball drops near cow corner
a couple more to an urgent Ponting, again hitting it over the in field, this too is not middled and up in the air for a fraction longer, but drops safely wide of deep midwicket
comes onto the front foot and punches the ball to extra cover
pitches back of a length, the off cutter from Kallis, angles back in and Ponting, though cramped for room a touch, opens the face and guides it past gully
lunges forward and turns the ball to midwicket, sending Marsh back
not a lot of foot movement but with the ball pitched up in the slot all Marsh needs to do is tee off and swing the ball over mid-on's head for a boundary, good hit that
sees some room and frees the arms, chopping past backward point
pitches full to lure Ponting forward, pushing and missing by a whisker
pulls a shorter ball across the line, in the air and not middled, Kallis runs in from deep midwicket and dives forward, the ball drops just in front and he does well to stop
comes forward and unleashes a firm drive to Botha at mid-off
well bowled, pitches on a length and Marsh cannot beat the off side
comes onto the front foot and dabs an off-cutter down to third man
shuffles across and clips this one past midwicket for another single

ah, close but safely edged away! It was a deliberate dab from Ponting, aiming to pick the gap at gully, but the ball nips back with some extra bounce and takes an edge that evades a tumbling McKenzie at a sort of wide slip and Ponting picks up four more
smart batting from Ponting, pressing forward to dab the ball into the covers
comes forward and plays the ball to the off side
pitches on leg and slants down, Marsh rolls the wrists and gets two more
pitches on the stumps, Marsh nudges it to cover and sprints off
stands his ground and squirts this ball wide of backward point
138ks, short and lifting and he throws the bat it it but is beaten by the subtle away movement, Boucher takes it high behind the stumps
comes forward and punches this delivery to the off side, yelling 'wait!'
presses forward, then back, and cuts uppishly into the gap at cover
leans forward and reaches out to drive, Amla cuts it off well at mid-off and return a sharp throw which Albie collects, just to keep the batsmen on their toes
tossed up and Ponting comes forward, steering into the covers for one
tossed up on the stumps and Marsh flicks to deep square leg
pitches on off and turns back in sharply, tucked around to short fine leg
tosses it up a tad wide and now Ponting pinches the gap at point
fuller this time, Marsh comes out and drives it back to Botha, who fumbles the stop and allows the single
skips down and flicks it intentionally over midwicket for a couple
lovely shot from Marsh, clipping a straight delivery wide of mid-on
opens the face and mistimes the dab towards backward point
bit of swing there, except it is down the pads for a wide
lunges forward and ends up playing it back past Albie, towards mid-on, and Ponting calls for the scampered single but Marsh says hold your horses, then sees the ball pass the fielder and runs
gets a wider one and guides it past gully for a single
pitches down the stumps, Ponting pirouettes and paddles the ball down towards fine leg, where de Villiers slides brilliantly and parries it to Kallis, who throws it back
comes forward and dabs the ball towards the fielders
tossed up from around the stumps, good drift, Marsh defends it back
that straightens after pitching and Marsh knocks it to the on side for one
tossed up bit too straight, Ponting paddles it fine to raise Australia's 100
uses his feet and drives it down the ground past mid-on, raising his fifty
shuffles across and turns it fine, Boucher and square leg converge and Marsh has to send an enthusiastic Ponting back
gets some room and cuts the ball away for a single to keep strike

aha, driven loosely in the air to Botha at extra cover, who spills the chance to his left! Albie pitches on a length and Marsh plays a loose shot off the back foot, hits it flat to Botha, who falls over and clasps at the ball but cannot hold on
pitches on the stumps and flicked straight to midwicket
on the stumps again, this time nudged wide of the fielder
opens the face to dab it fine but he cannot pick out the gap this time
pitches on the pads, swings down, and that is a sweet little deflection
and again, too straight and this time hit past midwicket for one
tossed up and he plays the ball away watchfully
tossed up on a length, Marsh drives to cover, who cuts it off
makes room and drives inside out to Gibbs at cover, who stops again
this time he shuffles and flicks it nicely into the gap at midwicket
uses his feet to collect on the full and clips it wide of midwicket
flighted on a good length, Marsh waits for it to turn and steers to point
well stopped at cover by Gibbs, after Marsh drives a full delivery hard
cute angled bat shot, just using the pace to steer a single to third man

pitches down the stumps and Ponting paddles it around the corner, he doesn't manage any bat on it and the ball dribbles to fine leg off his gloves, Ponting sprints the first one and a full-stretch of the bat on the second just gets him home before a goof flat throw comes back to Boucher, a loud cheer as NOT OUT flashes across the big screen
this one stops on Ponting, lunging forward to defend, and it rolls back
drives off the front foot, steering it to backward point, where Gibbs dives well
well played, Albie dangerously drifts onto Ponting's pads and he clips it handsomely over square leg and its a one-bounce four to the Australian captain
well played, Marsh, who gets back and cuts late and wide of gully
floated up on the stumps, good drift, Marsh makes room and drives to cover
loud cheers across Tasmania as Ponting raises his fifty, rocking back and bunting the ball into the gap between cover and point
tossed up wide, Marsh comes forward and dabs it wide of gully
pitches and grips, Ponting gets across and paddles straight to square leg

another drop to a very plucky Ponting! Botha proposes with a lobbed up delivery, Ponting accepts with a miscued slog sleep in the air out to deep midwicket, where Ntini falls forward only to let the ball out of his grasp, for four to boot, very straightforward catch goes down and Ponting is given his second life by South Africa
pitches very full to beat the bat outside off stump, well bowled by Kallis
not wide by any margin but Marsh, cramped, angles it down past point
too straight and he shuffles to nudge it off his pads toward square leg
he likes this shot, ala Graeme Smith! Marsh opens the face and squirts to gully
pitches on the seam and nips in, he again dabs the ball wide of gully
lands on a drivable length and Ponting goes on the rise to mid-off
tossed up on the stumps, Ponting chips it over midwicket, very intentionally, and does so well to just beat two men running across on the boundary ropes
gets across and paddles with the spin, but he can't beat square leg
flatter and drifting down, and he now manages to pinch one past midwicket
makes himself some room and drives wide of cover, Steyn fields it
pitches outside off stump, driven straight to the man at cover
goes for the paddle but yells in agony as short fine leg dives across
hits a length just outside off stump and Marsh plays it back to Kallis
change of pace, 115.8ks, Marsh plays a loose shot this time
even slower, 112ks, Marsh adjusts and dabs it wide of point
short ball surprises Ponting, lunging forward, but he adjusts to get back and ride the bounce with a steer towards backward point
pitches and nips back in, Ponting is surprised again and shapes to whip it across, but ends up edging down to gully instead, all along the ground
makes room and takes a couple steps out, collecting it on the half-volley and punching into the covers, from where another shy at the stumps fails to connect
tossed up, some drift, flicked to midwicket where Botha slides and stops
nicely played by Marsh, dancing down and creating room, square-driving
once more he makes room and drives, this time past cover, and that wristy shot brings up the 150 for Australia
still Marsh continues to make room, slashing backward of point
lobbed up ever so slowly on the stumps and Ponting turns it away for one
tossed up on a length and now Marsh makes a mess of the attempted cut
pitches on a fullish length and Ponting drives the ball to midwicket

finally someone holds on, and its de Villiers who sashays across to his left to pouch the offering at deep backward square leg! Ponting swivels on an ambitious pull shot but gets underneath it and sends the ball down de Villiers' throat, the end of a charmed innings from Ponting
fullish on middle and leg, clipped straight to midwicket
bang, thats four! Kallis rolls his fingers over another cutter but its too short on about leg stump so Hussey pulls that in a flash and picks the gap at square leg too
follows up with a full delivery which he defends awkwardly back
slower ball, 117ks, slants away but Hussey gets right over it, tapping to the off side and calling Marsh through the for quick single, thats smart running
tossed up outside off stump and Hussey drives into the off side
comes forward and opens the face, but backward point reacts quickly
uses his feet to clip that one off the stumps for another single
tossed up on middle and off, drifts in and Hussey defends watchfully
now he comes forward and picks out the gap at extra cover
drives it to the left of Duminy, who dives and takes pace off the shot
pitches outside leg stump and slants in, dabbed straight to point
pitches outside leg again, fuller, Hussey dabs it to midwicket
swing and a miss as Hussey sees a shorter ball, just cannot connect
this time he connects on the pull and picks the gap at midwicket, it was not that short but Hussey spotted the slower ball and gave it his all
shuffles across and turns the ball straight to the fielder
covers off stump and cuts the ball away through square to keep strike
tossed up on the stumps, driven straight to the on side fielders
a tip-and-run from Hussey, dabbing to cover and sprinting off, Gibbs swoops in and knocks down the stumps but Marsh stretches well forward and just makes it
back away to expose the stumps, then pushes the ball back to Duminy
moves back to cut but just misses out by a whisker, well taken by Boucher

good diving catch! Marsh remains bogged down and doesn't use his feet much, looking to turn the ball to midwicket but closing the face too early and the leading edge is brilliantly taken by Gibbs, sliding in from extra cover and grasping it mere inches off the turf
tossed up, David pushes forward on the drive and misses, and Boucher too fumbles the take
tossed up outside off and Michael drives the ball wide of point
too short and David hammers the pull out to deep midwicket for one
tossed up too straight and that is lapped around the corner
flatter delivery, David wants to flick it away but mistimes the shot
drifts down wide, Boucher cannot collect it cleanly either
comes out and flicks it off the half-volley just wide of midwicket
dragged in short and Michael flat-bats the ball out to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg and nicely swept out to deep square leg
comes onto the front foot and drives it straight to the man at cover
tossed up fuller, Michael makes room and steers into the off side
flighted on a teasing line, starts to dip, again driven straight to cover
uses his feet and chips the ball away for a quick single
too full and that one is clipped down to wide long-on
flighted outside off stump and David drives a single to extra cover
bit wide and he cuts to de Villiers at backward point
skips out and drives it back to the bowler, who misfields to allow one
starts to drift down the pads and David paddles it to short fine leg
tossed up on off stump, this time he drives to extra cover
pitches down leg stump for a wide, Boucher breaks the sticks
well tossed up on the stumps and David drives it back to Botha
flighted on the stumps and he nudges the ball toward midwicket
slower delivery, well flighted on the pads, driven with an inside edge to leg
tosses it up and David on-drives a single into the gap at midwicket
gets forward and puts the wrists into work, flicking across the stumps
fuller delivery starts to dip and he drives it back to a diving Duminy
tosses it up to draw a dragged attempt at an off-drive, Duminy fields himself
did he get fingertips on it? Kallis draws a loose poke from Michael with another of those crafty cutters, he edges it just wide of a diving Boucher, didn't carry though
pitches short of a length and he goes back to push to the off side
now a fuller, straighter delivery which David flicks to midwicket
pitches on the upright seam, driven to cover, who underarms and misses
131ks, on the stumps and he shuffles to turn the ball past midwicket
slower ball, 112ks, well spotted and gently driven to extra cover
too flat outside leg stump and it allows Michael to nudge it away
fires it flatter and David, advancing down, mistimes the booming drive
skips down, Duminy sees him and bowls it flat, clipped to midwicket
slower delivery from Duminy and David pinches a single into the covers
smart batting, just pushed into the off side and he calls for it
another single, shuffled and bunted away wide of the fielders
in the air and taken by a diving backward point! Kallis gets another, rolling the fingers across a cutter which Michael scoops in the air to Gibbs, sliding and taking it to his right
off the mark first ball, tucking one off the pads past midwicket
hit just over mid-off's head for four, David comes forward and then holds on when he spots the slower ball, and then bunts it over the extended fingertips of the fielder
fuller on the pads and he shuffles to clip this one to midwicket
pitches on a good length to keep White quiet, he defends it back
pitched up on the stumps and White drives to a sliding extra cover
pitches on the stumps and he plays it watchfully away for a sharp single
hits the seam and nips in to White, who can only defend it back
White falls to a soft dismissal, just chipping straight to Botha at midwicket
pitches on the stumps and he defends to midwicket first up
safest place to score your runs! Pitches just outside off stump and too close to cut, but Haddin plays the shot and gets a fortuitous inside-edge back past Boucher's left
full and straight and a more conservative approach from Haddin now
pitches down the stumps and David Hussey shuffles to clip it away
some bounce there, hitting the deck and jumping up to beat a weak prod, some very good carry through to Boucher behind the stumps, around head height
slips in the full-length cutter, and Haddin drives it back to the off side
forces him back in his crease, shuffling and nudging to midwicket for one
slower delivery, 112.3ks, whipped from off stump to midwicket
backs away and pushes the ball down to Amla at mid-on
slants into Haddin's pads and he clips the ball straight to midwicket
change of pace, very straight and turned in the air toward midwicket
pitches fullish just outside off stump, 151.8ks, pushed to cover
backs away to outside leg stump, Steyn follows him with a good delivery and this one is hit down towards mid-on in the end
the change-up, 116.3ks, he shuffles and clips the ball to the on side
150.6ks, he backs away to cut but then doesn't play a shot
attempted yorker to Haddin, who makes room to leg and misses the ball
yorker again, this time outside off stump, which he jams to gully
another full ball chases David Hussey as he moves outside leg stump, he manages to get bat on ball and drives it straight back past the stumps
slips in a low full toss, which Haddin flicks to midwicket, Amla runs across from mid-on and slides, then throws it back but misses with David Hussey short of his crease
another attempted yorker, change of pace, David Hussey drags to the on side
full again, well directed stuff, Haddin clips to Amla on the leg side
pitches full and wide, Haddin checks the wrists and drives it back down past the stumps, yelling "Two, Huss!" and some smart hustling gets them two as wel
pitches closer to the stumps and he bunts a single down to long-on
attempted yorker ends up a low full toss, which he pats into the covers
reaches out to drill a wider, fullish delivery past mid-off for one more
and he's gone, looking to get innovative! David Hussey backs away only to scoop a full and wide delivery off the toe end of the bat straight to Morkel at backward point
full and wide, down goes Hopes on the square-drive, missing completely
full on the stumps, driven to midwicket, Albie misfields and on the second run a bat goes missing but both Haddin and Hopes cross safely
back of a length and he squirts it down toward third man
swings at one sliding down the stumps but fails to connect
short, wide and rising, Hopes hops up and goes over point, Ntini slides and saves a boundary on the ropes
attempted yorker slips out down the pads, Hopes shapes to flick but gets pad on it, evading an energetic dive from Boucher, so that will be leg-byes
full on the pads and flicked through midwicket, Amla gives chase
full outside off stump, Hopes plays a loose shot and gets beaten
118ks, slower ball draws a forward push back to Steyn
swipes across the line and misses, and the ball somehow missing skimming the top of middle and leg
too full and wide down the pads, and Boucher does collect this time
gets down to square-drive the wide delivery out to Kallis at deep cover
frees the arms and slashes but finds Amla at backward point
146.7ks, pitched up very full and Hopes can only steer one to point

starts off with the sucker ball, full and wide and another scoop to backward point, where Morkel takes a good tumbling catch to his right, cupping it in front and then throwing it away as he hurts a finger
beaten for pace first ball, swishing at one pitched up full outside off
opens his account with a squirted single into the covers
now Haddin goes downtown, collecting on the full to drive past mid-off
overpitched outside off stump and Haddin drags it to mid-on
looks for the yorker but gets it too full, Harris drives to extra cover
pitches full and wide, Harris manages bat and scampers down the track
wide ball, sliding down the pads, Boucher fumbles the take too
waits this time and dabs the ball to Amla at backward point
attempted yorker ends up a full toss, which is flicked past short fine leg
slower ball, 119.4ks, well spotted and pushed to cover for one
swing and a miss, 147ks outside off and it cuts past the bat
pitches on the stumps this time and he turn it uppishly to midwicket
backs away, Ntini pitches full and Harris toe-ends it wide of point
smart stuff, thats full, fast and wide and Haddin can't pick it up at all
this one is a fraction wider, still well directed, and is called wide
serves up a low full toss, which Haddin clubs toward mid-on
moves the back leg across, then slashes an edge down to third man

now thats something I haven't seen for a while! Ntini pitches full and straight, Haddin swings a straight drive back onto the stumps, the ball ricochets away and Harris set offs, Haddin has no chance and Ntini runs back and gleefully uproots a stump
and a wicket off the last ball, as Harris gets under the ball and scoops it off the toe end of the bat, up and over the infield and it settles in Duminy's palms at deep mid-off

inn2.comm: hits the seam and wobbles away, Gibbs leaves as it shapes away
pitches on off stump and Gibbs drives to the man at midwicket
pitches full and wide and shapes away and Gibbs leaves
comes forward and pushes into the covers to get South Africa away
shorter delivery sit up and Amla, wanting to leave, cannot drop the hands in time and gets a thick edge well along the ground toward gully and wide of slips
140ks, pitches and swing away from Gibbs, who leaves
pitches outside leg stump, cannot get bat on it brushes pad
pitches in line and swings in, he clips the ball to midwicket
there's some zip off the track, sitting up and beating the drive
too straight and Amla shuffles to deflect it down to fine leg
130.7ks, pitches on off stump and straightens, defended
pitches on leg stump, swings down, Gibbs turns it away to square
hits a length and he keeps this one out
well stopped by Warner in the covers, diving to his left to intercept a drive from Amla, that was pitched up and Amla hit it off the middle
watches the ball closely and plays this one out too
cracks this one off the back foot but straight to point
pitches on the seam and moves away and Amla leaves it be
140.3ks, shorter this time and Amla hops up to play, but inside-edges near the stumps, the ball rolls away safely in the end
pitches on the pads, well flicked but Marsh is brilliant at square leg
pitches back of a length and goes on with the angle, Gibbs leaves
well bowled, pitched right up on the stumps and he defends
pitches on a drivable length and Gibbs pushes it to mid-off
lands on middle and off, nips back, and Amla plays to midwicket
pitches full on off stump and bunted back past the bowler and stumps
beaten! Gibbs chases from the crease and the swings undoes him
oh that was lucky! Gibbs hops across to turn the ball away but it gains on him and he plays a dolly of a leading edge that somehow balloons up and beats two fielders
far better shot, meeting it on the full and driving past extra cover
on the pads and delicately clipped down to deep fine leg
pitches down the stumps and he takes a hand off bat as he plays
pitches just outside off stump, played straight toward point
lands on a good length just outside off, Amla pushes to cover
a touch too short and Amla gets up to force it behind point for one
133.5ks, angling away off the seam and no shot offered
pitches on a length to commit him forward, Gibbs defends to the off
well bowled, served up full and swinging away, he leaves it be
back of a length and wobbling away, again no shot offered
hits a length and swings away, Amla punches off the back foot to cover
pitches much straighter this time and he flicks it to midwicket
edged and taken at first slip! Amla flashes a tame drive at one pitched up and he gets a thick outside edge over the top of White's head, the extra bit of bounce undid him
146ks, short of a length and he leaves it be for Haddin
hits the dime again and seams away, Kallis shoulders arms
much fuller but still in the channel and no shot offered
brings Gibbs well forward and he steers the ball down to third man
pitches full and Kallis defends off the front foot to point
135ks, short of a length, Kallis jumps up and defends
pitches on middle and leg and goes the other way, squaring up Kallis as he pushes forward, the thick outside edge squirts to gully and Gibbs calls Kallis through
much fuller on the stumps and he patiently pats it back to Bracken
hits the seam and wobbles away and Gibbs shoulders arms
pitches right up on the money to get Kallis defending solidly
that is away, forced off the back foot to the left of point, speeding away
pitches wide and doesn't swing, so thats a wide to Haddin
140ks, much better line and length and Kallis defends to leg
change of pace, 122ks, nearly foxes Kallis, who shuffles across and starts to flick it but has to hurry and defend, he gets an inside edge off the scrambled seam
now he drops short and Kallis punches straight to point
goes back again and pushes it firmly to the off side
hits a good length first ball and Gibbs pushes off the front foot to cover
slides back with swing, 147ks, catching Gibbs above the flap
pitches on the stumps and Gibbs defends
now some aggression from Gibbs, who takes a couple steps down and hits the ball over extra cover, taken on the full and carried on with the stroke
jumps up off a length and takes the shoulder of the bat, tough bounce
slides down the pads and he turns the ball away to square leg
pitches outside leg stump and turned down to square leg
126.5ks, full and wide, no swing, and Kallis leaves it alone
gets room and crunches off the back foot, but can't beat cover-point
pitches full and on the stumps and Kallis has to now defend
hops outside the line and ends up pushing it back to Hopes
back of a length, holds its line, Kallis hops and defends with an edge to third man, he is looking to get outside the line and work the ball away to leg a lot
nips back in off a length, Kallis gets up and defends to the off side
now Kallis finds the gap on the off side, standing tall and driving hard
fuller, by a fraction, and this time Kallis plays it to backward point
imperious! Kallis goes straighter this time, collecting the ball on the rise and drives through extra cover, high elbow and all, take note young batting aspirants
better length from Harris and Kallis dabs the ball to the off side
nips back in sharply but Kallis adjusts to drop the ball to the leg side
tip-and-run, gently nudged in front of point, a quick look up to see what Gibbs is doing, there's a brief nod and the two batsmen set off, thats top running that
brings him onto the front foot and he drives the ball to point
short ball, slides over Gibbs' head and he pulls out of the shot
pitches on a length, Gibbs taps it to backward point but can't get one
short of a length, too straight, he uses the wrists to turn the ball away
much better stuff, 129.7ks, full and swinging, Kallis defends
pitches on a length and Kallis nudges the ball into the covers with ease
leans forward and drives the off-cutter into the covers for one more
more urgency in the running, hops back and defends to the off side, calls for the single and chances Ponting's arm, he misses his mark and Gibbs is home
makes room, skips down, and slaps the ball through the off side
goes back quickly and cuts the ball firmly behind point, running hard
125.8ks, attempted yorker, dug out and clipped toward mid-on
digs in a short ball down the stumps, Gibbs gets inside the line and paddles it around the corner, Hilfenhaus covers good ground and slides to save a boundary
forces him back on the crease, defending it back
pitches full and straight and Kallis presents a full face of the bat
shuffles across the sticks, exposing leg, and turns the ball fine for one
pulled out to the deep! Gibbs decides to take on a short cutter from Hopes, but takes the ball on the splice and picks out the man kept back precisely for this type of shot
pitches and slides down, AB shuffles and turns the ball to square leg
he shuffles and taps it, starts off, and Kallis says hold your horses
pitches and swings down the pads, worked with an inside edge to leg
146.6ks, holds it back to make AB play off the back foot
dropped in short, this time AB rides the bounce and chops to third man
fuller on about off stump, works the wrists and plays it to midwicket
attempted yorker down leg stump, Kallis clips it down to fine leg
lovely use of the wrists, collecting off the pads and flicking it away
goes back to steer it to point, wants one but AB says no thanks, chief
tidy stuff this from Hopes, not offering room and Kallis defends to off
and now he strays with the width, offering Kallis the chance to rock back and punch the ball square of the pitch, and he beats the men at cover and point
slides over the stumps off a short length, Kallis ducks and wide is called
serves it full and wide, Kallis kneels forward and crashes a square-drive
back of a length, he gets back and steers the ball to backward point
starts to move across to knock the ball to midwicket but Hopes keeps it straight around off stump and AB has to end up pushing it back watchfully, well bowled
change of pace, pitches it up and Kallis drives straight to cover
drifts down the pads, flicked in the air, one bounce to Hilfenhaus at sweeper
shuffles and just drops the ball to the on side, Kallis calls him across
drifts down the pads, tucked around the corner to square leg
short and wide, he opens the shoulders and drives into the off side
pitches straighter and he drives the ball to mid-on
tossed up and he comes forward to defend the ball
tossed up a touch short, Kallis rocks back and punches it away
works it across the stumps but cannot beat midwicket either
comes forward and plays the ball to the on side, tidy stuff this
now he gets one, using his feet and beating mid-on
tossed up on the stumps, he uses his feet and clips it away
pitches full and AB pokes at it, beaten by the lace of pace
overpitched a bit wide, AB drives into the ground, cover fields
walks across his stumps, so you can see all three, and takes the ball on the full with a steered drive into the covers
pitches on the stumps and he works the ball to midwicket
and again, tidy stuff and the batsman can only turn it to the leg side
pitches outside off, Kallis takes it and clips it across the line for one
drops it short and Kallis punches the ball into the off side for one
tossed up on off stump, AB gets across and on-drives a single
comes across the stumps and flicks the ball away to midwicket
welcome boundary to AB, dancing down and swatting the ball over midwicket, it drops in no man's land and beats the sweeper running across, top shot
drifts down the pads and he turns it past square leg for one
tossed up, Kallis jumps across to outside off stump and turns it fine
pitches on a drivable length and Kallis drives on the rise to cover
a bit too straight and he shuffles across, turning the ball off the pads
the length brings AB forward, he doesn't get a stride in but he does cover off stump, the ball nips back and strikes him outside the line as he shapes to dab it fine
walks into the shot but cannot beat backward point
too straight and he shuffles to clip the ball wide of midwicket
strides forward and square-drives behind of point, just the single
tossed up and Kallis takes on the full, hitting down to long-on
well flighted, AB comes forward and steers the ball to point
reaches for it and clips across the line past a diving midwicket

more gentle tapping and running, Hussey tosses it up and Kallis gets right over the ball, dabbing it to the off side and calling for the run, direct hit comes in but replays show the batsman was well home
fuller and flatter and AB plays it back watchfully to David Hussey
tossed up, he gets across but cannot beat midwicket this time
short of a length, rocks back and punches to Ponting at short cover
dicey shot from Kallis, pushing the bat loosely out in front of his pads, stopping the shot and the ball goes up in the air for a while but ends up safe of cover
swings down leg stump, AB shuffles and clips it away for one
good shot from Kallis this time, walking across and flicking from outside off stump, picking the gap at midwicket
slower ball, 119ks, a tad too wide so AB drives on the rise for one
collects a short-pitched ball from outside off stump and ensures to roll the wrists, pulling down into the gap in front of square, the sweeper does the cleaning up
tossed up on the stumps, Kallis comes forward and pushes to cover
gets some room, waits for turn and glides the ball down to third man
flight it up, some drift, AB comes forward and drives to cover
tossed up and defended
comes out and flicks past Ponting at midwicket, running hard
flat on leg stump, or thereabouts, and AB works it to midwicket
tossed up on a length and uppishly hit towards extra cover
a tad short and he forces the ball away wide of backward point
tossed up this time, sliding down the pads to Haddin
flights it up, no turn, AB leans forward and drives to cover
floated up wide and he miscues the booming drive wide of point
tossed up generously to bring Kallis driving to extra cover
spins down leg stump and he turns a single off his pads
pitches on a length and that is driven firmly into the covers
139.7ks and spitting up off a crack or something, surprising everyone! Kallis does extremely well to arch back and drop his hands, and Haddin is also deceived by the late movement and awkward bounce
pitches full and straight and clipped through midwicket for one
pitches full and Kallis bunts it back to Harris, who jumps up to field
much wider, Kallis crashes the cut to David Hussey at point
short of a length, Kallis hops and drops it wide of Haddin, calls for the single, Haddin chases and nails an under-arm type flick but AB has crossed ages ago
there's his fifty, driving a tossed up delivery through the covers
flights up again and Kallis crashes the booming drive past cover
flights it wide, there's plenty of turn and bounce to beat everyone
slides down the pads and AB tucks it around the corner this time
flighted up full and he takes it on the half-volley, driving past cover
gets to the pitch and drives the ball back to White, who fields
pitches outside off stump and he forces it behind point for a single
nips back off a length, he opens the face and steers it to third man
bad ball, short and wide but AB cuts to David Hussey at point
much better from Harris, hitting the seam and making AB defend
goes for a cramped cut and almost chops it back, Haddin leaps and takes
change of pace, full on middle and off, pushes down to mid-on
short and he cuts from off stump and wide of the point fielder
flights it up very generously, with dip, and Kallis square-drives it away
flighted up on the stumps, again dipping, and AB pushes to mid-off
hangs it up there outside off stump, Kallis flashes it out to deep point
comes down and drives on the full into the covers for another single
this turns the other way and Kallis, walking across, flicks it away fine
nips back in, stays low, and Kallis hustles to push it wide of cover
thats a handsome drive from AB, for another single past extra cover
slower ball sits up and beats Kallis, pushing away from the body
waits for it and he opens the face, dabbing it down to third man
plays an odd sort of shot, swatting off the front foot to mid-on
whew, walks across to the fifth stump and clips it wide of midwicket
tossed up, turns away, Kallis strides forward and steers it to point
comes forward and drives it back to Hussey's left side
lobbed up, drifts into leg stump, flicked to Ponting at midwicket
flat trajectory again, flicked to Ponting
slower, wider, and steered to Harris at backward point
collects on the full and on-drives, Ponting scurries across and intercepts
just 116ks, full and wide and squeezed backward of point
a bit of room on offer and Kallis cuts behind point out to the sweeper
pitches short, stays low, cracked off the back foot past cover-point
walks well across, advancing to expose all the stumps and more, and then removes a hand off the bat handle to nudge a short ball wide of Haddin
dug in short and AB pulls along the ground to Michael in the deep
another single, crunched on the rise through the gap at extra cover
tossed up, Kallis drives on the rise and straight to cover
fired in flat and he drives it back to Hussey on the bounce
comes forward and steers this one towards cover for one
spins down the pads and brushed out past midwicket for a single
picks up the back leg and clips the ball down to long-on for one
pushes against the turn and hits it in the air but safe of the cover fielder
pitches on a length, moves away, Kallis chases it away from the body and gets a thick outer edge that doesn't carry to a leaping Haddin behind the stumps, lucky
dragged in short, this time he controls the shot, chopping to third man
pitches on leg, AB goes back and flicks it past square leg
140ks, a bouncer with two men back, Kallis hooks and misses
gone, and the man to get! Kallis chases a wide delivery and picks out David Hussey at backward point, who doesn't have to do much to pouch the aerial cut
overpitched outside off and he twirls a drive out Michael in the deep
ah, edged but it doesn't carry! AB starts giving catching practice, walking across his stumps to chase one going away from him, steering it just in front of a tumbling slip
shuffles across and play the ball to the fielder
you don't need to run for those! Harris pitches full and straight on the stumps and AB lays into it with a perfect on-drive back past mid-on
change of pace but AB uses soft hands to dab a single to point
pitches back of a length and squeezed toward backward point
low full toss escapes down leg stump, Duminy walks right across the sticks and just gets the bottom part of the bat on ball, and more than enough to beat Haddin

AB trips and he's gone! Hilfenhaus pitches on the stumps, AB shuffles and taps the ball just wide of midwicket and harries off down the track, he gets the first in good time but stumbles as he turns back for the second, still he continues sprinting and dives full stretch but a good flat throw from Harris comes back to Haddin in time, that was a terrific throw and well taken too
pitches full and wide and he opens the face to dab through gully
short of a length and played to the man fielding up close
pitches on the stumps, 141.3ks, and patted back to the bowler
split-fingered cutter, slower too, and he nearly pops it back
leans into a drive and plays it towards the cover fielder
tossed up and he nearly drives it back, but it doesn't carry
tossed up and McKenzie drives it down the ground for one
spins back in, he doesn't move much and pushes to midwicket
tossed up, McKenzie smothers it and defends to point
cute little open-faced steer down to third man and some hustling
moves back and cuts from the top of off stump through point
pitches outside leg stump, Duminy shuffles and glances it fine
flirts at one outside off stump and misses by a fraction
opens the face and steers it down to third man for a single
gets more room and uses the pace to dab the ball to third man
change of pace, 118.8ks, full and he defends it back
tip-and-run to point, the fielder has a shy but misses and Duminy is safe
angles the face and runs it well wide of Haddin to third man
134ks, swing and a miss, ball cuts back and stays low too
short-pitched ball over the stumps and Duminy ducks under it
pitches on leg and slides in, Duminy turns it straight to midwicket
goes for a cramped cut and chops it back in front of Haddin
finally he pierces the off side, steering a shorter ball past point
too straight and Duminy flicks the ball away to deep square leg
short ball slides down leg stump, no shot offered, Haddin takes
flashes the square-drive and squeeze the ball between point and gully
gently nudges the ball to the off side and calls on McKenize, well run
goes flashing from the crease and connects with nuttin' but air
dabs it towards gully, Duminy responds, backward point runs across and hits the stumps, it is referred but Duminy had made his ground rather comfortably
first international wicket for Harris! A nothing shot from McKenzie, trying to run one down to third man from too close to the body he succeeds in chopping onto his stumps
gets a short delivery and steers it down past backward point
140ks, short-pitched over leg stump, Duminy flinches a tad
walks into the shot, pushing down to mid-off, who is rather deep
pitches full, and swings it, Boucher clips it right to midwicket
loose shot, with one hand, sort of steered to backward point
controlled shot, picked from just outside off and on-driven for one
pitches outside leg stump, cramps Boucher, who taps it back
angles across off a length and he jams the ball wide of point
back of a length and he shuffles across, just knocking it to the on side
comes forward and turns the ball across for a single
pitches straight and he taps the ball towards midwicket
starts off full and Duminy eases the pressure with a lovely little drive past extra cover, no frills attached whatsoever
the response is an errant bouncer down leg stump, Duminy goes pulling but cannot connect on it
short on middle and leg, and short-arm-jabbed out to the sweeper
much fuller, and straighter, and he drives with an inside edge to leg
lands on about leg stump, Boucher shuffles and clips it away
pitches on a length and Duminy crisply drives on the up past point

he likes that shot but it nearly led to his downfall! Hilfenhaus pitches full down leg stump and Duminy walks across to paddle-flick it in the air down to deep square leg, but the ball dips in front of a diving Ryan Harris and drops a couple feet short of him
bowls it from around the stumps, Boucher steers it in in front of point
shuts his eyes and heaves and gets a thick top edge that flies over Haddin, it doesn't reach the ropes because three fielders give hearty chase
pitches full and Boucher punches it back to Bracken
full and he sizes up for midwicket, clearing the front leg and heaving, but there is just a thin inside edge that beats Haddin and the off stump, very, very close
slices a low full toss to cover, Ponting has a shy but misses
tidy bowling, full and straight and Boucher hits the nonstriker's stumps
pitches on a length outside leg stump, Duminy swings and misses, the ball hits his back leg and deviates wide of the stumps
overpitched outside off stump and driven toward extra cover
slips in a yorker which Duminy misses all ends up
and he picks the gap behind square leg, swatting it past Bracken
swings again, struck on the back heel just outside leg stump
finishes off with a yorker length delivery outside off stump, Boucher tries to squirt it out and just gets the toe end on it, Harris runs toward cover and slides to cut it off
well bowled and fielded, Bracken fires it in full, Boucher pushes it the off side, Bracken the runs across and fields before taking out middle stump with his throw
another crafty yorker draws an inside edge to short fine leg
pitches full and Duminy swings it along the ground past midwicket
another yorker outside off stump which he squirts to point

so well bowled, and the frustration results in a run out! Bracken fires in yet another mesmeric yorker, which Duminy fails to pick, he sets out of his crease and pays the price as Haddin knocks down the stumps with an accurate throw
thats the way to go, leaning into a wider one and picking the gap at point
pitched up in the slot, Boucher clears the leg and goes over mid-on
swings at a low full toss and picks the gap behind square leg
backs away and miscues the shot over extra cover, the ball stays up there for a while, Warner runs back after it but the ball drops safely in the deep
bad ball to bowl, a rank full toss and Boucher slices it over cover!
full again, Boucher makes room and inside-edges to deep square
slower ball on the stumps, swung away in a frenzy to deep midwicket
full outside off, tough to work away, Boucher paddles to square leg
bowls it full and very wide, Albie chases and misses, its not called wide somehow and Albie sets off, Haddin under arms but doesn't hit this time
walks across his stumps and digs out the ball wide of midwicket
connects on the full toss, not off the middle however, rather high off the bat, but Albie has picked the gap at mid-on and even long-on cannot get there in time
slips in the yorker wide of the stumps and he squeezes it for one
ends with another yorker outside off stump, Boucher swings and squirts an inside edge back past short fine leg, so thats only nine from the over
full on off stump, Boucher swings to deep midwicket, where Marsh fumbles
good delivery, and that should do it, a slower ball, very full and just outside off stump to fox Boucher as he swings and misses
Boucher! Boucher! He just clears the leg and swings that over long-on, and the fielder back pedals to see the ball sail over his head, its a six
very full on leg stump and now he clips it past midwicket for one
well bowled, full and wide and Albie can only steer it to deep point

well bowled, full and wide from Hilfenhaus in front of his home fans, Boucher just slaps it to extra cover for a single, so Australia have won a humdinger by five runs to level the series 1-1 after two games
